Label: LABEL
Definition: A definition

Label: clinical measurement data item
Definition: A quantitative or qualitative value which is the result of an act of assessing a morphological or physiological state or property in a single individual or sample or a group of individuals or samples, based on direct observation or experimental manipulation.

Label: cardiovascular measurement data item
Definition: Any value resulting from the quantification of a morphological or physiological parameter pertaining to the heart and/or blood vessels.

Label: blood pressure measurement data item
Definition: Measurement of the pressure, or force per area, exerted by circulating blood against the walls of the blood vessels. The pressure is dependent on the energy of the heart action, elasticity of the vessel walls and volume and viscosity of the blood.

Label: body weight data item
Definition: The heaviness or degree to which an entire organism's body is drawn to the earth by gravity.

Label: body morphological measurement data item
Definition: Measurement of the structure or forms of the entire body or parts of the body of an organism.

Label: body height data item
Definition: The vertical measurement of a body.

Label: pulse data item
Definition: The count of the rhythmic contractions and expansions of an artery due to the surge of blood from the beat of the heart.

Label: cardiovascular system disease
Definition: A disease of anatomical entity which occurs in the blood, heart, blood vessels or the lymphatic system that passes nutrients (such as amino acids and electrolytes), gases, hormones, blood cells or lymph to and from cells in the body to help fight diseases and help stabilize body temperature and pH to maintain homeostasis.

Label: disease of mental health
Definition: A disease that involves a psychological or behavioral pattern generally associated with subjective distress or disability that occurs in an individual, and which are not a part of normal development or culture.

Label: respiratory system disease
Definition: A disease of anatomical entity that located_in the respiratory system which extends from the nasal sinuses to the diaphragm.

Label: cancer
Definition: A disease of cellular proliferation that is malignant and primary, characterized by uncontrolled cellular proliferation, local cell invasion and metastasis.

Label: endocrine system disease
Definition: A disease of anatomical entity that is located_in endocrine glands which secretes a type of hormone directly into the bloodstream to regulate the body.

Label: disease
Definition: A disease is a disposition (i) to undergo pathological processes that (ii) exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism.

Label: hematopoietic system disease
Definition: A disease of anatomical entity that has_material_basis_in hematopoietic cells.

Label: gastrointestinal system disease
Definition: A disease of anatomical entity that is located_in the gastrointestinal tract.

Label: nervous system disease
Definition: A disease of anatomical entity that is located_in the central nervous system or located_in the peripheral nervous system.

Label: timeline
Definition: A directive information entity that specifies the sequence in which a series of events occurred or will occur.

Label: population data item
Definition: A data item that is about a population of organisms.

Label: population location
Definition: A population data item that is about the geographical location of a population of organisms.

Label: population size
Definition: A sample size that is about the count of individual organisms in a population.

Label: population quality
Definition: A quality which inheres in a population of organisms.

Label: population sex or sexes
Definition: A population quality concerning the sex or sexes of the population.

Label: population gender or genders
Definition: A population quality concerning the gender or genders of the population.

Label: population age range
Definition: A population quality concerning the age range of a population.

Label: blood collected from fasting subject
Definition: Blood that is collected from an organism which has been fasting for a given amount of time.

Label: biosample storage
Definition: A storage process for a biosample collected from an organism.

Label: genomic assay
Definition: An assay that investigates the genome or genomes of an individual organism or population of organisms.

Label: microbiome sequencing assay
Definition: A genomic assay that profiles the microorganisms present in a sample.

Label: eQTL analysis
Definition: A genomic assay that identifies genetic loci and candidate genes correlated with phenotypes.

Label: biosample size
Definition: A count of the number of biosamples collected for an investigation.

Label: biosample processing
Definition: A material processing which prepares a biosample for investigation.

Label: unique identifier
Definition: An identifier that is guaranteed to be unique among all identifiers in a particular domain.

Label: gender
Definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's preference towards a range of characteristics pertaining to, and differentiating between, masculinity and femininity.

Label: ethnicity
Definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's identification with a group of other individuals on the basis of presumed similarities such as language or common ancestry.

Label: birthplace location
Definition: A geographical location in which an individual was born.

Label: residence location
Definition: A geographical location in which an individual currently resides.

Label: education level
Definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virute of the bearer's highest level of formal education completed.

Label: family and household structure
Definition: Information that is about the structure of an individual's family and/or household.

Label: lifestyle history
Definition: A clinical history that is about the lifestyle and behaviors of an individual which may impact health outcomes.

Label: tobacco use history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the tobacco use or exposure of an individual.

Label: alcohol use history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the alcohol consumption of an individual.

Label: sleep history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the sleep quality and duration of an individual.

Label: nutritional history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the diet and nutrition of an individual.

Label: physician contact textual entity
Definition: A textual entity that contains contact details for an individual's physician, which may include: name, phone number, address, etc.

Label: surgical history
Definition: A clinical history that is about surgical operations performed on an individual.

Label: prescription drug history
Definition: A clinical history that is about the prescription drugs taken by an individual.

Label: disease treated by prescription drug
Definition: Information that is about the disease treated by a drug prescribed to an individual.

Label: response to medication
Definition: A biological process that results from a drug stimulus.

Label: summary statistic for federated data
IHCC Browser Label: summary statistics for additional data from federated sources
Definition: A statistic that summarizes a set of federated data.

Label: recreational drug history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the use of unprescribed and/or non-prescription drugs.

Label: physical activity history
Definition: A lifestyle history that is about the typical physical activity of an individual.

Label: other genomic assay
Definition: An uncategorized genomic assay.

Label: sample size
Definition: A count which represents the subset of a collection chosen for an investigation, survey, or assay.

Label: other organism substance
Definition: An uncategorized organism substance.

Label: biosample availability textual entity
Definition: An availability textual entity that is about a substance from an organism (a biosample).

Label: consent textual entity
Definition: A textual entity that documents the consenting process used to enroll patients in a study.

Label: genotyping assay
Definition: An assay which generates data about a genotype from a specimen of genomic DNA. A variety of techniques and instruments can be used to produce information about sequence variation at particular genomic positions.

Label: data collection
Definition: A planned process that is a part of an investigation in which raw data is collected.

Label: copy number variation profiling assay
Definition: An assay that determines lost or amplified genomic regions of DNA by comparing genomic DNA originating from tissues from the same or different individuals using specific techniques such as CGH, array CGH, SNP genotyping

Label: RNA-seq assay
Definition: An transcription profiling assay that determines an RNA sequence by analyzing the transcibed regions of the genome and or to quantitate transcript abundance.

Label: organism identification assay
Definition: An assay that identifies the organism species in a specimen.

Label: epigenetic modification assay
Definition: An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.

Label: whole genome sequencing assay
Definition: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of an entire genome of an organism.

Label: exome sequencing assay
Definition: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of the protein coding components of a genome (exons).

Label: whole metagenome sequencing assay
Definition: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information on the DNA sequences of multiple genomes (a metagenome) from different organisms present in the same input sample.

Label: study design
Definition: A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution.

Label: inclusion criterion
IHCC Browser Label: criteria for enrollment and recruitment procedures
Definition: an inclusion criterion (rule) is_a *eligibility criterion* which defines and states a condition which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process. For instance, in a study protocol, inclusion criteria indicate the conditions that prospective subjects MUST meet to be eligible for participation in a study.
Comment: Replaces GECKO 'criteria for enrollment and recruitment procedures'

Label: age
Definition: A time quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of how long the bearer has existed.

Label: biological sex
Definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ability to undergo sexual reproduction in order to differentiate the individuals or types involved.

Label: organismal quality
Definition: A quality that inheres in an entire organism or part of an organism.

Label: drug prescription
Definition: A health care prescription specifying the initiation, modification or cessation of a drug administration.

Label: drug administration specification
Definition: A drug administration description that specifies a drug administration prescribed or reported by an healthcare provider. It specifies: - The drug product - The posology It may also specify a starting drug administration condition

Label: date
Definition: Information about a calendar date or timestamp indicating day, month, year and time of an event.

Label: symptom
Definition: A quality of a patient that is observed by the patient or a processual entity experienced by the patient, either of which is hypothesized by the patient to be a realization of a disease.

Label: blood
Definition: A fluid that is composed of blood plasma and erythrocytes.

Label: organism substance
Definition: Material anatomical entity in a gaseous, liquid, semisolid or solid state; produced by anatomical structures or derived from inhaled and ingested substances that have been modified by anatomical structures as they pass through the body.

Label: urine
Definition: Excretion that is the output of a kidney.

Label: saliva
Definition: A fluid produced in the oral cavity by salivary glands, typically used in predigestion, but also in other functions.

Label: feces
Definition: Portion of semisolid bodily waste discharged through the anus.
